articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — The Israeli government formally declared war Sunday and gave the green light for “significant military steps” to retaliate against Hamas for its surprise attack, as the military tried to crush fighters still in southern towns and intensified its bombardment of the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Israel declares war and approves 'significant' steps to retaliate for surprise attack by Hamas

articles.author: RIAZAT BUTT
articles.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Men dug through rubble with their bare hands and shovels in western Afghanistan Sunday in desperate attempts to pull victims from the wreckage left by powerful earthquakes that killed at least 2,000 people.
articles.title: Desperate people dig out dead and injured from quakes that killed over 2,000 in Afghanistan.

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump is again testing the power of his endorsement.With an early morning social media post on Friday, Trump inserted himself into the chaotic race to replace Kevin McCarthy as House speaker by backing Ohio Rep.
articles.title: Trump is inserting himself into the messy race to become the next House speaker. Will it matter?

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT and ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — The ad sounds like something out of the GOP 2024 playbook, trumpeting a senator’s work with Republicans to crack down on the flow of fentanyl and other illegal drugs into the U.S., getting tough on Chinese interests helping smugglers, and noting how he "wrote a bill signed by Donald Trump to increase funding for Border Patrol.”
articles.title: Biden faces more criticism about the US-Mexico border, one of his biggest problems heading into 2024

articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — The area around the Maui town largely destroyed by wildfire two months ago was scheduled to welcome back travelers on Sunday as the mayor and Hawaii’s governor pushed ahead to restart tourism to boost the economy despite opposition from some Lahaina residents.
articles.title: Tourism resuming in West Maui near Lahaina as hotels and timeshare properties welcome visitors

articles.author: CLAIRE SAVAGE
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — Alexander watches Paw Patrol with fervor, bowls his baby brother over with hugs and does everything with gusto.What the 3-year-old West Chicago toddler can’t do yet is speak more than a few words.
articles.title: A workforce crisis is damaging families' access to therapies for babies with developmental delays

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA and JOANNA KOZLOWSKA
articles.description: HROZA, Ukraine (AP) — U.N. and local investigators searched for answers on Saturday at the site of a Russian missile strike on a small Ukrainian village that days earlier turned its sole cafe to rubble and killed nearly 52 people gathered for a dead soldier’s wake, according to President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and other top officials in Kyiv.
articles.title: Days after deadly missile strike on Ukrainian cafe, grief and a search for answers

articles.author: GEIR MOULSON
articles.description: BERLIN (AP) — Germany's center-right opposition won two state elections on Sunday at the halfway mark of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's unpopular national government, and a far-right party that has been riding high in national polls made gains, projections showed.
articles.title: German conservative opposition seen winning 2 state elections, with far-right making gains

articles.author: JILL LAWLESS
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Members of Britain’s opposition Labour Party gather in Liverpool on Sunday for their annual conference with an unfamiliar feeling: optimism.The party has been out of power for 13 years, and in the last national election in 2019, voters handed Labour its worst drubbing since 1935.
articles.title: After years in opposition, Britain's Labour Party senses it's on the verge of regaining power

articles.author: RALPH D. RUSSO
articles.description: Oklahoma moved up to No. 5 in The Associated Press college football poll Sunday, Miami's late-game gaffe nearly cost the 25th-ranked Hurricanes a spot in rankings and six basketball blue bloods made some history.
articles.title: AP Top 25: Oklahoma jumps to No. 5, Miami slides after epic gaffe and hoops schools make history
